question_sentence: Legendary quarterback Tom Brady retired from the NFL after 22 seasons. How many Super Bowls has he won?
A cold snap in Florida is really different. Which Floridian critter can get so cold it becomes immobilized?
Super Bowl 56 tickets are the most expensive in the game's history. What’s the current average amount people are paying for seats?
Possibly paving the way for limb regeneration in people, scientists were able to regrow legs on what animal?
Rihanna is pregnant! Who is she expecting a baby with?
Which of these animals was taken into custody at a Pentagon security area?
Sony announced its purchase of video game studio Bungie for $3.6 billion. Which popular Xbox franchise did Bungie create?
Speaking of purchases, which company bought popular puzzle game Wordle?
The Washington Football Team announced its new name, which is:
Comic book stores are sending students in Tennessee copies of which book after a local school board banned it?
Which Nordic country scrapped all coronavirus-related laws despite infections reaching record highs?
evidence: Denmark’s prime minister, Mette Frederiksen, told reporters that “the pandemic is still here but with what we know, we now dare to believe that we are through the critical phase”

question_sentence: Israel’s Foreign Ministry described a leaked report by which human rights organisation as a “collection of lies” and “anti-Semitic”?
evidence: The report, which was leaked ahead of its planned publication next week, accuses Israel of “enforcing a system of apartheid against the Palestinian people” and of treating Palestinians as “an inferior racial group”.

question_sentence: Who won an unofficial “people’s primary” organised by leftist activists ahead of the April’s French presidential election?
evidence: The former justice minister was selected as the “unity” candidate to run against Emmanuel Macron. A total of 467,000 people voted online.

question_sentence: Sue Gray’s inquiry was reportedly told Carrie Johnson and her friends danced to which song at a lockdown-breaching “victory party” after Dominic Cummings quit No. 10?
choices: We Are the Champions by Queen
Winner Takes It All by Abba
evidence: A source told The Mail on Sunday that there was “banging and dancing and drinking” in the Johnsons’ Downing Street flat during the party on 13 November 2020.

question_sentence: NFL icon Tom Brady announced his retirement, but how many Super Bowls did the 44-year-old quarterback win in his career?
evidence: In a career spanning 22 seasons, Brady won six titles with the New England Patriots before his final win with the Buccaneers last year.

question_sentence: Record numbers of women are reaching 30 without children, according to new ONS data. What proportion of 30-year-olds was child-free?
evidence: In 1971, just 18% of women were childless at 30. Today, nearly one in five women aged 45 are childless.have no children

question_sentence: Which countries imposed further sanctions against officials in Myanmar on the first anniversary of a military coup?
choices: Australia, New Zealand, and the UK
evidence: The military took control of Myanmar after claiming that Aung San Suu Kyi’s landslide election win in November 2020 was the result of voter fraud.

question_sentence: Which tennis champion won his 21st grand slam title at the Australian Open?
evidence: Nadal took the men’s singles title after a gruelling five-and-a-half hour match against Russia's Daniil Medvedev.

question_sentence: Which senior MP was ordered to leave the House of Commons after refusing to withdraw his allegation that Boris Johnson “wilfully misled” MPs about Downing Street parties?
evidence: The SNP’s leader in Westminster was ordered to leave the Commons on Monday afternoon for breaking parliamentary rules which say you cannot accuse a fellow MP of lying.

question_sentence: MMR vaccination rates in England have hit a ten year low, the UK Health Security Agency has warned. What percentage of children aged five had received both doses of the vaccine, according to data covering July to September 2021?
evidence: The figures mean more than one in ten children starting school are at risk of measles. Health officials say 10% of parents were not aware the NHS was still offering routine vaccinations during the pandemic.

question_sentence: Which streaming service is under pressure after several artists threatened to pull their work from the platform, stating it hasn’t done enough to prevent the spread of Covid-19 misinformation?
evidence: Spotify received a wave of criticism from a number of prominent artists who said they will leave the platform if it continues to host comedian Joe Rogan, whose podcast has spread misleading and inaccurate claims about vaccines and the pandemic.

question_sentence: NFL legend Tom Brady announced he will retire at the age of 44. How many Super Bowls did he win during his 22-year career?
evidence: Brady won seven Super Bowls — six with the New England Patriots and one with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

question_sentence: Which country recently fired off its most powerful ballistic missile in years, signaling a possible escalation in their weapons program?
evidence: North Korea fired its most powerful ballistic missile in years this week, a sign its weapons program is escalating and larger tests may possibly come.

question_sentence: Which tennis star won a historic Australian Open title after an epic men’s final?
evidence: Rafael Nadal clinched a record-breaking 21st grand slam title after beating Medvedev in an Australian Open final for the ages. Nadal has now surpassed Djokovic, who has 20 Grand Slam titles and would have been a heavy favorite for a 21st. However, he withdrew from the tournament after a protracted vaccination controversy.

question_sentence: Lunar New Year, known as Spring Festival in China, was celebrated this week. What year have we entered, according to the Chinese zodiac?
evidence: China welcomed the Year of the Tiger with a light show illuminating the skylines of four cities: Beijing, Wuhan, Chongqing and Qingdao. Check it out here!

question_sentence: Which US group could soon be eligible to receive Covid-19 vaccinations?
evidence: Children younger than 5 in the US could soon begin receiving Covid-19 vaccinations. Pfizer and BioNTech are seeking emergency use authorization from the FDA for their two-dose vaccine for children as young as 6 months.

question_sentence: Punxsutawney Phil saw his shadow on Groundhog Day! According to tradition, what does this mean?
evidence: If Phil’s prediction is correct, this means there will be six more weeks of winter.

question_sentence: Which company is marketing next-day job offers as an answer to the current labor shortage?
evidence: Home Depot announced an “accelerated” hiring process, which includes speedy job offers within one day of applying.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden announced he is sending thousands of US troops to support NATO countries as Russian troops continue amass along Ukraine’s border. Where exactly are the troops headed?
evidence: The US is sending a total of 3,000 US troops to Poland, Germany and Romania. The deployments are a show of support to NATO allies feeling threatened by Russia’s steady military buildup near the Ukrainian border.

question_sentence: A total of 73 Confederate monuments were removed or renamed in 2021. How many monuments remain standing in the US and its territories?
evidence: About 700 Confederate monuments are still standing in the US and its territories. Though these statues allegedly commemorate the Civil War era, a majority of such monuments were erected after 1900 — 35 years or more after the Civil War ended.
